title: Business Travel Made Easy With Smart Packing and an Atlanta Airport Shuttle (Atl Shuttle)
text: By Atl Shuttle Aug 4, 2015 Traveling on business can leave you exhausted, stressed, and hungry. It could even leave you without the necessities or lost in a strange city if you don't plan accordingly. Before you embark on a business trip, make sure you have the items you need, plans in place, and proper transport, like an Atlanta Airport Taxi to help things go smoothly.There's nothing worse than forgetting something important, like underwear or cables and chargers. If you travel often, have a travel bag packed and ready to go at all times. Include underwear and socks, all the chargers and cables you'll need, and drop in some snacks, like an energy bar or some nuts. While you can add a change of clothes at the last minute, having the basics already in the bag will keep you from having that "oh-no" moment when you arrive. All toiletries and several days of any medication should be tucked away in the event of a delay, or unexpected overnight stay.Arriving late because your plane was delayed, leaving you no time for a meal before a meeting, can spell certain disaster. Have something that can fill you up and supply energy without the sugar crash will ensure that you get through your meeting without issue. It's also helpful if you experience a long delay in the airport or on the tarmac.Booking a cheaper flight that takes you through stops may wind up costing you in the long run. A more direct flight means less can go wrong. With flight cancellations and delays that are more common these days, spending a bit more is a smart move. Leaving things to chance when it comes to departure -day ground transport or when you arrive at your destination is not wise. Book an Atlanta Airport Shuttle to take you to Hartsfield-Jackson, or when you arrive in the A-T-L. That way there is no chance you'll lose time trying to find parking, or in getting lost if you're not from the Atlanta area. Drivers know where to go and the best way to get there, considering the constant road construction.One other word of advice - sign up for TSA pre-check to help speed your way through security, and wear slip-on shoes if possible. The stress of long security lines can leave you frazzled. Make sure you have some comfort devices for the flight, like noise-canceling headphones and eye shades if you think you'll need some shut-eye. It probably goes without saying, but checking bags is a waste of time and could leave you high and dry if your luggage is lost. Pack wisely in a carry-on, with the items you'll want on the plane stored in an outer compartment. Having everything in one bag means you are far less likely to leave anything behind in the Atlanta Airport taxi you rode in.
